member.name: T:Phidgets.AccelerometerAxis
member.summary: This class represents an axis of acceleration for a Phidget Accelerometer. All the properties of an Accelerometer axis are stored and modified in this class.
member.remarks: A Phidget Accelerometer axis object stores the acceleration data for that axis. The sensitivity of the acceleration readings for the realted axis is implemented in this class.

member.name: P:Phidgets.AccelerometerAxis.Sensitivity
member.summary: The sensitivity property represents the read sensitivity of the acceleration data for this axis.
member.remarks: The sensitivity property gets/sets the sensitiviy data member. This is the difference in acceleration that must appear between succesive calls to the OnAccelerationChange event handler.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.AccelerometerAxis.Acceleration
member.summary: The acceleration property represents the acceleration data for this axis.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.AccelerometerAxis.AccelerationMax
member.summary: The AccelerationMax property represents the largest acceleration value that this axis will return
member.remarks: If the returned acceleration is equal to this maximum, assume that this axis has been saturated - the actual acceleration could be higher.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.AccelerometerAxis.AccelerationMin
member.summary: The AccelerationMin property represents the largest (negative) acceleration value that this axis will return
member.remarks: If the returned acceleration is equal to this minimum, assume that this axis has been saturated - the actual acceleration could be higher.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: T:Phidgets.AccelerometerAxisCollection
member.summary: This class represents the collection of axes related to a Phidget Accelerometer. All the methods and properties used to axes the available axes are implemented in this class.
member.remarks: This class contains the count of the available axes and the axis indexer to access the axes.

member.name: P:Phidgets.AccelerometerAxisCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: The AccelerometerAxis indexer list.
member.param: The axis index. Index 0 is the x-axis, 1 is the y-axis, and 2 is the z-axis (where available).
member.returns: The axis object stored at that index that represents the corresponding axis.

member.name: T:Phidgets.ServoServo
member.summary: This class represents a servo motor for a Phidget Servo. All the properties of a servo motor are stored and modified in this class.
member.remarks: A Phidget Servo servo object stores the position data for that motor.

member.name: M:Phidgets.ServoServo.setServoParameters(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets custom servo parameters for using a servo not in the predefined list. Pulse widths are specified in microseconds.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.ServoServo.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position property of the servo motor.

remarks.para: Note that since servo motors do not offer any feedback in their interface, this value is simply whatever the servo was last set to. There is no way of determining the position of a servo that has been plugged in, until it's position has been set. Therefore, if an initial position is important, it should be set as part of initialization.

member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the position is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.ServoServo.PositionMax
member.summary: Represents the largest position value that this motor will accept
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.ServoServo.PositionMin
member.summary: Represents the smallest position value that this motor will accept
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.ServoServo.Engaged
member.summary: Gets or sets the engaged property of the servo motor.

remarks.para: Setting this to true sends the servo to the currently set position - and holds it there. Setting this to false will remove the holding force, so the servo can be freely rotated by hand.

member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Phidget.open(System.Int32)
member.summary: Open this Phidget with a specific serial number.

remarks.para: Open is pervasive. What this means is that you can call open on a device before it is plugged in, and keep the device opened across device dis- and re-connections.

Open is Asynchronous. What this means is that open will return immediately – before the device being opened is actually available, so you need to use either the attach event or the waitForAttachment method to determine if a device is available before using it.
This version of open specifies a serial number - The serial number is a unique number assigned to each Phidget during production and can be used to uniquely identify specific phidgets.

member.param: The Serial Number

member.name: M:Phidgets.Phidget.open
member.summary: Open a Phidget without a serial number.
member.remarks: The first available Phidget will be opened. If there are two Phidgets of the same type attached to the system, you should specify a serial number, as there is no guarantee which Phidget will be selected by the call to open().

member.name: M:Phidgets.Phidget.open(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Open a Phidget remotely using an IP Address, without a serial number.
member.remarks: This version of open is network based. This method is the same as open(int serialNumber, string IPAddress, int port), except that it specifies no serial number. Therefore, the first available Phidget will be opened. If there are two Phidgets of the same type attached to the system, you should specify a serial number, as there is no guarantee which Phidget will be selected by the call to open().
member.param: The server IP address.
The server port.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Phidget.open(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Open this Phidget remotely using an IP Address, and a specific serial number.

remarks.para: This version of open is network based.

This version of open specifies a serial number - The serial number is a unique number assigned to each Phidget during production and can be used to uniquely identify specific phidgets. use open(string IPAddress, int port) to open a device without specifying the serial number.

member.param: The Serial Number
IP Address or hostname of the Phidget Webservice
Port of the Phidget Webservice

Therefore, the first available Phidget will be opened. If there are two Phidgets of the same type attached to the system, you should specify a serial number, as there is no guarantee which Phidget will be selected by the call to open().

member.summary: Open this Phidget with a specific label.

remarks.para: Open is pervasive. What this means is that you can call open on a device before it is plugged in, and keep the device opened across device dis- and re-connections.

Open is Asynchronous. What this means is that open will return immediately – before the device being opened is actually available, so you need to use either the attach event or the waitForAttachment method to determine if a device is available before using it.
This version of open specifies a label - The label can be set and changed by using the setLabel method (setLabel is unsupported on Windows).

member.name: M:Phidgets.Phidget.waitForAttachment
member.summary: Waits for this Phidget to become available.

remarks.para: This method can be called after open has been called to wait for thid Phidget to become available. This is usefull because open is asynchronous (and thus returns immediately), and most methods will throw a PhidgetException is they are called before a device is actually ready. This method is synonymous with polling the isAttached method until it returns True, or using the Attach event.
This method blocks indefinitely until the Phidget becomes available. This can be quite some time (forever), if the Phidget is never plugged in.
This method uses the attach handler internally to determine when the Phidget becomes available.

member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Phidget.waitForAttachment(System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits for this Phidget to become available for the specified time.

remarks.para: This method can be called after open has been called to wait for thid Phidget to become available. This is usefull because open is asynchronous (and thus returns immediately), and most methods will throw a PhidgetException is they are called before a device is actually ready. This method is synonymous with polling the isAttached method until it returns True, or using the Attach event.
This method blocks indefinitely until the Phidget becomes available. This can be quite some time (forever), if the Phidget is never plugged in.
This method uses the attach handler internally to determine when the Phidget becomes available.

member.param: Specified wait time in milliseconds
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened, or if the time limit expires before an attach is detected.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Phidget.close
member.summary: Closes this Phidget.
member.remarks: This will shut down all threads dealing with this Phidget and you won't recieve any more events. This should be called before closing your application or things may not shut down cleanly.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.ID
member.summary: Gets the ID of this Phidget.
member.remarks: This ID specifies a specific Phidget device, within the phidget class.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.SerialNumber
member.summary: Gets the unique serial number of this Phidget.
member.remarks: This number is set during manufacturing, and is unique across all Phidgets. This number can be used in calls to open to specify this specific Phidget to be opened.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.Version
member.summary: Gets the device version of this Phidget.
member.remarks: This number is simply a way of distinguishing between different revisions of a specific type of Phidget, and is only really of use if you need to troubleshoot device problems with Phidgets Inc.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.Attached
member.summary: Gets the attached status of this Phidget.
member.remarks: This method returns True or False, depending on whether the Phidget is phisically plugged into the computer, initialized, and ready to use - or not. If a Phidget is not attached, many functions calls will fail with a PhidgetException, so either checking this function, or using the Attach and Detach events, is recommended, if a device is likely to be attached or detached during use.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this Phidget.
member.remarks: This is a string that describes the device. For example, a PhidgetInterfaceKit could be described as “Phidget InterfaceKit 8/8/8”, or “Phidget InterfaceKit 0/0/4”, among others, depending on the specific device.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.Type
member.summary: Gets the device type of this Phidget.
member.remarks: This is a string that describes the device as a class of devices. For example, all PhidgetInterfaceKit Phidgets will returns the String "PhidgetInterfaceKit".
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.Label
member.summary: Gets / sets the label associated with this Phidget.
member.remarks: This label is a String - up to ten characters - that is stored in the Flash memory of newer Phidgets. This label can be set programatically, and is non-volatile - so it is remembered even if the Phidget is unplugged.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if this Phidget does not support labels.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.AttachedToServer
member.summary: Gets the attached to server status of this Phidget.
member.remarks: For Phidgets opened over the network, returns the status of the connection to the server.
member.exception: If this Phidget was not opened over the network.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.Address
member.summary: Gets the Phidget Webservice network address for a Phidget opened over the network.
member.remarks: This may be an IP Address or a hostname.
member.exception: If this Phidget was not opened over the network, or if the server is not connected.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.ServerID
member.summary: Gets the Phidget Webservice server id for a Phidget opened over the network.
member.remarks: This is an arbitrary server identifier, independant of IP address and Port. This is only available if the Phidget was opened with ServerID.
member.exception: If this Phidget was not opened over the network via ServerID, or if the server is not connected.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Phidget.Port
member.summary: Gets the Phidget Webservice port for a Phidget opened over the network.
member.exception: If this Phidget was not opened over the network, or if the server is not connected.

member.name: E:Phidgets.Phidget.Detach
member.summary: Detach event.
member.remarks: The detach event is called when this Phidget is phisically detached from the system, and is no longer available.

member.name: E:Phidgets.Phidget.Error
member.summary: Error event.
member.remarks: The error event is called when an asynchronous error occurs. This is generally used for network errors, and device hardware error messages.

member.name: E:Phidgets.Phidget.ServerConnect

member.name: E:Phidgets.Phidget.ServerDisconnect
member.summary: Server disconnect event
member.remarks: This is called for network opened Phidgets when a connection to the Phidget Webservice has been broken - either by calling close, or by network trouble, etc.

member.name: T:Phidgets.Manager
member.summary: This class represents a Phidget Manager.

remarks.para: The Phidget manager is a way to keep track of attached phidgets, it will send Attach and Detach events as Phidgets are added and removed from the system.
The Phidget manager returns special instances of Phidget objects that are not actually connected to opened Phidgets but can be used to get serial number, name, version, etc.

member.remarks: Will attempt to close the manager if it has yet to be closed.

member.summary: Starts the PhidgetManager.
member.remarks: This method starts the phidget manager running. If attach and detach listeners are to be used, they should be registered before start is called so that no events are missed. Once start is called, the Phidget Manager will be active until close is called.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Manager.open(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Open this Manager remotely using an IP Address.
member.remarks: This version of open is network based.
member.param: IP Address or hostname of the Phidget Webservice
Port of the Phidget Webservice

member.name: M:Phidgets.Manager.open(System.String)
member.summary: Open this Manager remotely using a Server ID.
member.remarks: This version of open is network based.
member.param: ServerID of the Phidget Webservice

member.name: M:Phidgets.Manager.open(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Open this Manager remotely and securely, using an IP Address.
member.remarks: This method is the same as open(String ipAddress, int port), except that it specifies a password. This password can be set as a parameter when starting the Phidget Webservice.
member.param: IP Address or hostname of the Phidget Webservice
Port of the Phidget Webservice
Specified password

member.name: M:Phidgets.Manager.open(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Open this Manager remotely and securely, using a Server ID.
member.remarks: This method is the same as open(String serverID), except that it specifies a password. This password can be set as a parameter when starting the Phidget Webservice.
member.param: ServerID of the Phidget Webservice
Specified password

member.name: M:Phidgets.Manager.close
member.summary: Shuts down the Phidget Manager.
member.remarks: This method should be called to close down the Phidget Manager. Events will no longer be recieved. This method gets called automatically when the class is destroyed, but it's still a good idea to call it explicitely.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Manager.Devices
member.summary: A list of attached Phidgets.
member.remarks: This list is updated right before the attach and detach events, and so will be up to date within these events.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Manager.Address
member.summary: Gets the Phidget Webservice network address for a Manager opened over the network.
member.remarks: This may be an IP Address or a hostname.
member.exception: If this Manager was not opened over the network, or if the server is not connected.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Manager.ServerID
member.summary: Gets the Phidget Webservice server id for a Manager opened over the network.
member.remarks: This is an arbitrary server identifier, independant of IP address and Port. This is only available if the Manager was opened with ServerID.
member.exception: If this Manager was not opened over the network via ServerID, or if the server is not connected.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Manager.Port
member.summary: Gets the Phidget Webservice port for a Manager opened over the network.
member.exception: If this Manager was not opened over the network, or if the server is not connected.

member.name: P:Phidgets.Manager.AttachedToServer
member.summary: Gets the attached to server status of this Manager.
member.remarks: For Managers opened over the network, returns the status of the connection to the server.
member.exception: If this Manager was not opened over the network.

member.name: E:Phidgets.Manager.Attach
member.summary: Attach event.
member.remarks: The attach handler is called when a Phidget is physically attached to the system.

member.name: E:Phidgets.Manager.Detach
member.summary: Detach event.
member.remarks: The detach handler is called when a Phidget is phisically detached from the system.

member.name: E:Phidgets.Manager.Error
member.summary: Error event.
member.remarks: The error event is called when an asyncronous error occurs. This is only used for network errors for Managers opened over the network.

member.name: E:Phidgets.Manager.ServerConnect
member.summary: Server connect event
member.remarks: This is called for network opened Managers when a connection to the Phidget Webservice has been established.

member.name: E:Phidgets.Manager.ServerDisconnect
member.summary: Server disconnect event
member.remarks: This is called for network opened Managers when a connection to the Phidget Webservice has been broken - either by calling close, or by network trouble, etc.

member.name: T:Phidgets.TemperatureSensor
member.summary: This class represents a Phidget temperature Sensor. All methods to read temperaure data from the sensor are implemented in this class.

remarks.para: The Temperature Phidget consists of a thermocouple interface, and a temperature sensing IC, which is used to measure the temperature of the thermocouple cold junction and calibrate the thermocouple sensed temperature.
Both the thermocouple and temperature IC (ambient sensor) temperatures can be read. Values are returned in degrees celcius.

member.name: F:Phidgets.TemperatureSensor.ambientSensor
member.summary: The Phidget TemperatureSensor ambient sensor.
member.remarks: This is the board ambient temperature sensor.

member.name: F:Phidgets.TemperatureSensor.thermocouples
member.summary: The collection of available thermocouples.

member.name: M:Phidgets.TemperatureSensor.#ctor
member.summary: Class Constructor.
member.remarks: Calling this opens a connection to the phidget21 C library creates an internal handle for this Phidget, ready to call open on.

member.name: M:Phidgets.TemperatureSensor.Finalize
member.summary: Class destructor/finalizer.
member.remarks: Will attempt to close the phidget if it has yet to be closed.

member.name: E:Phidgets.TemperatureSensor.TemperatureChange
member.summary: Temperature Change Event.
member.remarks: The temperature change handler is called when the temperature has changed by at least the Sensitivity trigger value that has been set.

member.name: T:Phidgets.LED
member.summary: This class represents a Phidget LED. All methods to control a Phidget LED are implemented in this class.

remarks.para: The Phidget LED is a board that is meant for driving LEDs. Currently, the only available version drives 64 LEDs, but other versions may become available so this number is not absolute.
LEDs can be controlled individually, at brightness levels from 0-100.

member.summary: Class destructor/finalizer.

member.name: T:Phidgets.TextLCDCustomCharacter
member.summary: This class represents a custom character that is defined for the TextLCD.
member.remarks: Custom characters can be inserted anywhere into the display string.

member.name: M:Phidgets.TextLCDCustomCharacter.setCustomCharacter(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set this custom character.

remarks.para: The custom character is defined by two integers.
The two Integers define the character. Each character is 8x5, the first integer defines the top 4x5 and the second the bottom 4x5.
Each 4x5 half-character is defined by 5 hex bytes:
There is a generator utility that will generate the integers for you here: http://www.phidgets.com/documentation/customchar.html

member.param: First value given by the customchar utility
Second value given by the customchar utility

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDCustomCharacter.StringCode
member.summary: The character code associated with this character.
member.remarks: Insert this into strings sent to the display where you would like this character to appear.

member.name: T:Phidgets.TextLCDCustomCharacterCollection
member.summary: The collection of custom characters that can be defined for the display.
member.remarks: The display handles 8 custom characters. These must be defined before they can be used. They will stay in the TextLCD memory until power is removed.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDCustomCharacterCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: The custom character object.
member.param: Index of the custom character in the collection
member.returns: The custom character object stored at the index in the collection

member.name: T:Phidgets.TextLCDRow
member.summary: This class represents a row of text display on the screen of the TextLCD.
member.remarks: a TextLCDRow object stores the text that will be displayed at the row specified by the provided index. Currently, TextLCDs only support 2 rows of text display.

member.name: F:Phidgets.TextLCDRow.columns
member.summary: Collection of characters in this row.
member.remarks: Use this for setting a single character instead of a whole row.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDRow.DisplayString
member.summary: Sets the display string of this row.
member.remarks: If the string is longer then the row, it will be truncated.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the row is invalid.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDRow.MaximumLength
member.summary: Gets the maximum length of this row.
member.remarks: Returns the number of columns (characters per row) available on the display. This value is the same for every row.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: T:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen
member.summary: This class represents a Screen connected to a TextLCD
member.remarks: A TextLCDScreen object stores the overall screen state, as well as a collection of screen rows.

member.name: F:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen.rows
member.summary: The collection of available rows of text display on the TextLCD screen.

member.name: F:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen.customCharacters
member.summary: The collection of defined custom characters.
member.remarks: A maximum of 8 custom characters can be defined at a time for the TextLCD screen.

member.name: M:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen.initialize
member.summary: Initializes the active screen
member.remarks: Only usable for the TextLCD Adapter.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen.Backlight
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the backlight property.
member.remarks: True indicates that the backlight is on, False indicates that it is off. The default state depends on the board.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen.Brightness
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the Brightness property.
member.remarks: For devices that support a range of backlight brightnesses.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or brightness is not supported.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen.Cursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the cursor property.
member.remarks: True turns the cursor is on, False turns it off. The cursor is an underscore which appears directly to the right of the last entered character on the display. The cursor is by default disabled.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen.CursorBlink
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the cursor blink property.
member.remarks: True turns the cursor blink on, False turns it off. The cursor blink is an flashing box which appears directly to the right of the last entered character on the display, in the same spot as the cursor if it is enabled. The cursor blink is by default disabled.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen.Contrast
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the contrast property.
member.remarks: This is the contrast of the entire display. The valid range is 0-255. Changing the contrast can increase the readability of the display in certain viewing situation, such as at an odd angle.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or the contrast value is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCDScreen.ScreenSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the screen size
member.remarks: Only settable for the TextLCD Adapter.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or the contrast value is out of range.

member.name: T:Phidgets.InterfaceKitAnalogSensor
member.summary: This class represents an analog sensor input for a Phidget InterfaceKit. All the properties of an analog sensor input are stored and modified in this class.
member.remarks: A Phidget InterfaceKit analog sensor input object stores the analog sensor data for that input. The sensitivity of the analog sensor readings for the related input is implemented in this class.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitAnalogSensor.RawValue
member.summary: Returns the raw value of a analog input.
member.remarks: This is a more accurate version of Value. Note that the analog outputs on the Interface Kit 8/8/8 are only 10-bit values and this value represents an oversampling to 12-bit.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitAnalogSensor.Sensitivity
member.summary: Gets or sets the change trigger sensitivity for an analog input.
member.remarks: This is the ammount that an inputs must change between successive SensorChangeEvents. This is based on the 0-1000 range provided by Value. This value is by default set to 10 for most Interface Kits with analog inputs.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitAnalogSensor.Value
member.summary: Returns the value of a analog input.
member.remarks: The analog inputs are where analog sensors are attached on the InterfaceKit 8/8/8. On the Linear and Circular touch sensor Phidgets, analog input 0 represents position on the slider.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitAnalogSensor.DataRate
member.summary: Represents the maximum rate at which events will be fired, in ms.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitAnalogSensor.DataRateMax
member.summary: The maximum supported data rate.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitAnalogSensor.DataRateMin
member.summary: The minimum supported data rate.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: T:Phidgets.InterfaceKitAnalogSensorCollection
member.summary: This class represents a collection of Analog Sensor Inputs.
member.remarks: This class contains the count of the available analog sensor inputs and the analog sensor input indexer to access the analog sensor inputs.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitAnalogSensorCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: The analog sensor input indexer list. This gets a reference to the analog sensor object stored at the supplied index locaiton in the collection list.
member.param: The analog sensor input index.
member.returns: A reference to the analog sensor object stored at the supplied index location in the collection list.

member.name: T:Phidgets.InterfaceKitDigitalInputCollection
member.summary: This class represents a collection of Digital Inputs. All the methods and properties used to access the available digital inputs are implemented in this class.
member.remarks: This class contains the count of the available digital inputs and the digital input indexer to access the digital inputs.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitDigitalInputCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: The digital input indexer list. This gets the state of a digital input at the supplied index in the list.
member.remarks: Digital inputs read True where they are activated and false when they are in their default state.
member.param: Index of the input.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the index is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitDigitalInputCollection.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of ditigal inputs on this Interface Kit.
member.remarks: Not all interface kits have the same number of digital inputs, and some don't have any digital inputs at all.

member.name: T:Phidgets.InterfaceKitDigitalOutputCollection
member.summary: This class represents a collection of Digital Outputs. All the methods and properties used to access the available digital outputs are implemented in this class.
member.remarks: This class contains the count of the available digital outputs and the digital input indexer to access the digital outputs.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitDigitalOutputCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: The digital output indexer list. This gets or sets the state of a digital output at the supplied index in the list.
member.remarks: Depending on the Phidget, this value may be either the value that you last wrote out to the Phidget, or the value that the Phidget last returned. This is because some Phidgets return their output state and others do not. This means that with some devices, reading the output state of a pin directly after setting it, may not return the value that you just set.
member.param: Index of the output.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the index is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKitDigitalOutputCollection.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of digital outputs on this Interface Kit.
member.remarks: Not all interface kits have the same number of digital outputs, and some don't have any digital outputs at all.

member.remarks: Speed ramping means that acceleration and velocity are used to send a series of different PWM pulses over time. Without speed ramping, the PWM is just set to the target position immediately - this is how the original Phidget Servo worked.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Dictionary.close
member.summary: Closes this Dictionary.

member.exception: if this Dictionary was not opened.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Dictionary.add(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new key to the Dictionary, or modifies the value of an existing key.
member.param: The key can only contain numbers, letters, ‘/’, ‘.’, ‘-‘, ‘_’, and must begin with a letter, ‘_’ or ‘/’.
The value can contain any characters.

The persistent value controls whether a key will stay in the dictionary after the client that created it disconnects. If persistent is false, the key is removed when the connection closes. Otherwise the key remains in the dictionary until it is explicitly removed.
member.exception: If this Dictionary was not opened, or if the server is not connected.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Dictionary.add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new key to the Dictionary, or modifies the value of an existing key.
member.remarks: The key will stay in the dictionary until explicitly removed.
member.param: The key can only contain numbers, letters, ‘/’, ‘.’, ‘-‘, ‘_’, and must begin with a letter, ‘_’ or ‘/’.
The value can contain any characters.
member.exception: If this Dictionary was not opened, or if the server is not connected.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Dictionary.remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a key, or set of keys, from the Dictionary.
member.param: The key name is a regular expressions pattern, and so care must be taken to only have it match the specific keys you want to remove.
member.exception: if this Dictionary was not opened.
If this Dictionary was not opened, or if the server is not connected.

member.name: T:Phidgets.InterfaceKit
member.summary: This class represents a Phidget Interface Kit. All methods to read and write data to and from an Interface Kit are implemented in this class.

remarks.para: There are many types of Interface Kits, but each is simply a collection of 0 or more digital inputs, digital outpus and analog sensors. Inputs can be read and outputs can be set, and event handlers can be set for each of these.
See your hardware documentation for more information on the I/O specific to your Phidget.

member.name: F:Phidgets.InterfaceKit.inputs
member.summary: The collection of available digital inputs.
member.remarks: Interface Kits can have 0 or more digital inputs. See your hardware documentation for more information on the I/O specific to your Phidget.

member.name: F:Phidgets.InterfaceKit.outputs
member.summary: The collection of available digital outputs.
member.remarks: Interface Kits can have 0 or more digital outputs. See your hardware documentation for more information on the I/O specific to your Phidget.

member.name: F:Phidgets.InterfaceKit.sensors
member.summary: The collection of available analog sensor inputs.
member.remarks: Interface Kits can have 0 or more analog sensor inputs. See your hardware documentation for more information on the I/O specific to your Phidget.

member.name: M:Phidgets.InterfaceKit.#ctor
member.summary: Class Constructor.
member.remarks: Calling this opens a connection to the phidget21 C library creates an internal handle for this Phidget, ready to call open on.

member.name: M:Phidgets.InterfaceKit.Finalize
member.summary: Class destructor/finalizer.
member.remarks: Will attempt to close the phidget if it has yet to be closed.

member.name: P:Phidgets.InterfaceKit.ratiometric
member.summary: Sets whether to use a ratiometric or fixed reference on the analog inputs.

remarks.para: Most sensors use the ratiometric model, where the returned value will be between 0 and +Vdd, where Vdd is the voltage supplied to the sensor - approximately 5v.
Some sensors output a specific voltage regardless of their supply voltage, and for these we provide a non-ratiometric fixed +5v reference.
The default value for this is ratiometric (true).
This only applies to interfacekit boards with analog inputs (8/8/8, TextLCD 8/8/8).

member.exception: If ratiometric is not supported, or the InterfaceKit is not opened and attached.

member.name: E:Phidgets.InterfaceKit.InputChange
member.summary: Digital inputs change event

remarks.para: The input change handler is called when an input on this InteraceKit board has changed.

member.name: E:Phidgets.InterfaceKit.SensorChange
member.summary: Analog input change event.

remarks.para: The sensor change handler is called when a sensor on this Interface Kit has changed by at least the Sensitivity value that has been set for this input.

member.name: E:Phidgets.InterfaceKit.OutputChange
member.summary: Digital output change handler.

remarks.para: The output change handler is called when an output on this InteraceKit board has changed.

member.name: T:Phidgets.StepperStepper
member.summary: This class represents a stepper motor attached to a Phidget Stepper Controller.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.Acceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets a motor's acceleration.
member.remarks: The valid range is between AccelerationMin and AccelerationMax. This controls how fast the motor changes speed. This value is in (micro)steps per second squared. The step unit will depend on the Stepper Controller. For example, the Bipolar Stepper controller has an accuracy of 16th steps, so this value would be in 16th steps per second squared.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if acceleration is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.AccelerationMax
member.summary: Represents the largest acceleration value that this motor will accept
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.AccelerationMin
member.summary: Represents the smallest acceleration value that this motor will accept
member.remarks: Note that an acceleration of 0 is not a valid value.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.Velocity
member.summary: Returns a motor's current velocity.
member.remarks: The valid range is between VelocityMin and VelocityMax, with 0 being stopped. This value is in (micro)steps per second. The step unit will depend on the Stepper Controller. For example, the Bipolar Stepper controller has an accuracy of 16th steps, so this value would be in 16th steps per second.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the velocity in unknown.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.VelocityLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a motor's velocity limit.
member.remarks: This is the maximum velocity that the motor will turn at. The valid range is between VelocityMin and VelocityMax, with 0 being stopped. This value is in (micro)steps per second. The step unit will depend on the Stepper Controller. For example, the Bipolar Stepper controller has an accuracy of 16th steps, so this value would be in 16th steps per second.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the value is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.VelocityMax
member.summary: Represents the largest velocity value that this motor will accept
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.VelocityMin
member.summary: Represents the smallest velocity value that this motor will accept
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.TargetPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a motor's target position.
member.remarks: Use this to set the target position for the stepper. If the stepper is engaged it will start moving towards this target position. Can also be used to get the currently set target position. The valid range is between PositionMin and PositionMax. This value is in (micro)steps. The step unit will depend on the Stepper Controller. For example, the Bipolar Stepper controller has an accuracy of 16th steps, so this value would be in 16th steps.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the position in unknown.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.CurrentPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a motor's current position.
member.remarks: Use this to (re)set the current physical position of the motor to a specific position value or to get the current position for the motor. This does not move the motor, and if the motor is moving, setting a value to this will cause it to stop moving. Set TargetPosition value to move the motor to a position. The valid range is between PositionMin and PositionMax. This value is in (micro)steps. The step unit will depend on the Stepper Controller. For example, the Bipolar Stepper controller has an accuracy of 16th steps, so this value would be in 16th steps.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the position in unknown.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.PositionMax
member.summary: Represents the largest position value that this motor will accept
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.PositionMin
member.summary: Represents the smallest position value that this motor will accept
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.CurrentLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a motor's current usage limit.
member.remarks: The valid range is between CurrentMin and CurrentMax. This sets the maximum current that a motor will be allowed to draw. Use this with the Bipolar stepper controller to get smooth micro stepping - see the product manual for more details. This value is in Amps. Note that this is not supported on all stepper controllers.
member.value: Requested current limit for the motor.
member.returns: Currently set current limit for the motor.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, if the value is unknown, or if this is not supported.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.Current
member.summary: Returns a motor's current usage.
member.remarks: The valid range is between CurrentMin and CurrentMax. This value is in Amps.
member.returns: The current usage of the motor.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, if the value is unknown, or if this is not supported.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.CurrentMax
member.summary: Represents the largest current value that this motor will accept
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.CurrentMin
member.summary: Represents the smallest current value that this motor will accept
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.Engaged
member.summary: Gets or sets the engaged property of the stepper motor.
member.remarks: This engages or disengages the stepper motor. The motors are by default disengaged when the stepper controller is plugged in. When the stepper is disengaged, position, velocity, etc. can all be set, but the motor will not start moving until it is engaged. If position is read when a motor is disengaged, it will throw an exception.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.StepperStepper.Stopped
member.summary: Gets the stopped property of the stepper motor.
member.remarks: Use this to determine if the motor is moving and/or up to date with the latest commands you have sent. If this is true, the motor is guaranteed to be stopped and to have processed every command issued. Generally, this would be polled after a target position is set to wait until that position is reached.
member.returns: The stopped state of a motor.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: T:Phidgets.WeightSensor
member.summary: This class represents a Phidget Weight Sensor. All methods to read weight data from the weight sensor are implemented in this class.
member.remarks: The Phidget Weight Sensor is simply an electronic scale with a USB interface. It provides one weight value, in kg.

member.remarks: Will attempt to close the phidget if it has yet to be closed.

member.name: E:Phidgets.WeightSensor.WeightChange
member.summary: Weight Change Event.

member.name: T:Phidgets.Servo
member.summary: This class represents a Phidget servo Controller. All methods to control a Servo Controller are implemented in this class.
member.remarks: The Phidget Sevo controller simply outputs varying widths of PWM, which is what most servo motors take as an input driving signal.

member.summary: Class Constructor.

member.summary: Class destructor/finalizer

member.name: M:Phidgets.TextLCD.initialize
member.summary: Initializes the active screen
member.remarks: Only usable for the TextLCD Adapter.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCD.Backlight
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the backlight property.
member.remarks: True indicates that the backlight is on, False indicates that it is off. The default state depends on the board.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCD.Brightness
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the Brightness property.
member.remarks: For devices that support a range of backlight brightnesses.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or brightness is not supported.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCD.Cursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the cursor property.
member.remarks: True turns the cursor is on, False turns it off. The cursor is an underscore which appears directly to the right of the last entered character on the display. The cursor is by default disabled.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCD.CursorBlink
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the cursor blink property.
member.remarks: True turns the cursor blink on, False turns it off. The cursor blink is an flashing box which appears directly to the right of the last entered character on the display, in the same spot as the cursor if it is enabled. The cursor blink is by default disabled.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCD.Contrast
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the contrast property.
member.remarks: This is the contrast of the entire display. The valid range is 0-255. Changing the contrast can increase the readability of the display in certain viewing situation, such as at an odd angle.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or the contrast value is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCD.ScreenCount
member.summary: Gets the number of supported screens
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or the contrast value is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCD.Screen
member.summary: Gets or sets the active screen
member.remarks: This sets the screen that all other API calls will apply to - only required for multi-screen TextLCDs.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or the contrast value is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLCD.ScreenSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the screen size
member.remarks: Only settable for the TextLCD Adapter.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or the contrast value is out of range.

member.name: T:Phidgets.TextLED
member.summary: This class represents a Phidget Text LED. All methods to control the Text LED are implemented in this class.
member.remarks: The Text LED is a Phidget that displays text and numerals on LED numeric display in rows. The number of rows and size of each row depends on your configuration.

member.name: F:Phidgets.TextLED.rows
member.summary: The collection of available rows of text display on the TextLED screen.

member.name: M:Phidgets.TextLED.#ctor
member.summary: Class Constructor.
member.remarks: Calling this opens a connection to the phidget21 C library creates an internal handle for this Phidget, ready to call open on.

member.name: M:Phidgets.TextLED.Finalize
member.summary: Class destructor/finalizer
member.remarks: Will attempt to close the phidget if it has yet to be closed.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLED.Brightness
member.summary: Gets or Sets the brightness of all rows.
member.remarks: The Default brightness is 100. The valid range is 0-100.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or the brightness value is out of range.

summary.para: This class represents a Phidget Accelerometer. All methods to read acceleration data from an Accelerometer are implemented in this class.

remarks.para: The Phidget Accelerometer provides 2-3 axes of acceleration data, at anywhere from 2g to 10g sensitivity, depending on the specific revision. See your hardware documetation for more information. They can measure both static (gravity) and dynamic acceleration.

member.name: F:Phidgets.Accelerometer.axes
member.summary: The collection of accelerometer axes.

remarks.para: Currently, accelerometers have either two or three axes of acceleration - x and y, or x, y, abd z.
The indexes of which - Index 0 is the x-axis, 1 is the y-axis, and 2 is the z-axis (where available).

member.name: M:Phidgets.Accelerometer.#ctor
member.summary: Accelerometer constructor.

member.name: M:Phidgets.Accelerometer.Finalize
member.summary: Accelerometer deconstructor.
member.remarks: Will attempt to close the Phidget device.

member.name: E:Phidgets.Accelerometer.AccelerationChange
member.summary: Acceleration Change Event.
member.remarks: This event is called when the acceleration of an axis changes by more then the set sensitivity.

member.name: T:Phidgets.TextLEDRow
member.summary: This class represents a row of text display on the screen of the TextLED.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLEDRow.DisplayString
member.summary: Sets the display string of a row.
member.remarks: If the string is longer then the row, it will be truncated.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the row is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLEDRow.MaximumLength
member.summary: Returns the number of columns (Characters per row).
member.remarks: This returns the maximum number of columns supported by the device, not neccessarily the number of columns actually available with your coniguration.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: T:Phidgets.TextLEDRowCollection
member.summary: This class represents a collection of TextLEDRows.
member.remarks: This class contains the count of the total number of rows on the TextLED and the indexer for accessing these display rows.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TextLEDRowCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: The TextLED row indexer list. This gets a reference to the TextLEDRow object stored at the supplied index locaiton in the collection list.
member.param: The TextLED row index.
member.returns: The TextLED row object for the specified index.

member.name: T:Phidgets.TemperatureSensorAmbientSensor
member.summary: This class represents the temperature IC (or Ambient sensor) on a Phidget TemperatureSensor.
member.remarks: A Phidget TemperatureSensor IC/Ambient sensor object stores the ambient board temperature. The sesnor's sensitivity can also be modified from this class. It can be used to measure the temperature of the thermocouple cold junction and calibrate the thermocouple sensed temperature.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TemperatureSensorAmbientSensor.Temperature
member.summary: Gets the temperature of the ambient sensor IC.
member.remarks: This value is returned in degrees celcius but can easily be converted into other units. The IC is calibrated during manufacture.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TemperatureSensorAmbientSensor.TemperatureMax
member.summary: Represents the largest temperature value that the ambient sensor could return.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TemperatureSensorAmbientSensor.TemperatureMin
member.summary: Represents the smallest temperature value that the ambient sensor could return.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: T:Phidgets.TemperatureSensorSensor
member.summary: This class represents a thermocouple sensor attached to a Phidget TemperatureSensor.
member.remarks: A Phidget TemperatureSensor thermocouple sensor object stores the thermocouple sensor data for that thermocouple sensor. The sensitivity of the temperature readings for the related thermocouple is implemented in this class.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TemperatureSensorSensor.Temperature
member.summary: Gets the temperature of this thermocouple sensor.
member.remarks: This value is returned in degrees celcius but can easily be converted into other units. The accuracy depends on the thermocouple used. The board is calibrated during manufacture.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TemperatureSensorSensor.TemperatureMax
member.summary: Represents the largest temperature value that this sensor could return.
member.remarks: This value will change when the Themocouple type is changed.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.TemperatureSensorSensor.TemperatureMin
member.summary: Represents the smallest temperature value that this sensor could return.
member.remarks: This value will change when the Themocouple type is changed.

member.name: P:Phidgets.PHSensorSensor.Potential
member.summary: Gets the Potential, in volts.
member.remarks: This returns the actual voltage potential measured by the ADC. A pH of 7.0 corresponts to a potential of 2.5v. This is the value that is internally used to calculate pH in the library.

member.summary: Represents the largest potential value that this sensor will return.

member.summary: Represents the smallest potential value that this sensor will return.

member.name: P:Phidgets.PHSensorSensor.Temperature
member.summary: Sets the probe temperature.
member.remarks: This temperature is used in calculating the PH, and can be set to ensure maximum accuracy. If this is not set, the default value of 25 degrees celcius is used.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: T:Phidgets.RFID
member.summary: This class represents a Phidget RFID Reader. All methods to read tags and set outputs on the RFID reader are implemented in this class.
member.remarks: The Phidget RFID reader can read one tag at a time. Both tag and tagloss event handlers are provided, as well as control over the antenna so that multiple readers can be used in close proximity without interference.

member.name: F:Phidgets.RFID.outputs
member.summary: The collection of available digital outputs.
member.remarks: Phidget RFID readers have 0 or 2 more outputs.

member.name: M:Phidgets.RFID.#ctor
member.summary: Class Constructor.
member.remarks: Calling this opens a connection to the phidget21 C library creates an internal handle for this Phidget, ready to call open on.

member.name: M:Phidgets.RFID.Finalize
member.summary: Class destructor/finalizer.
member.remarks: Will attempt to close the phidget if it has yet to be closed.

member.name: M:Phidgets.RFID.write(System.String,Phidgets.RFID.RFIDTagProtocol,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write data to a tag.
member.remarks: See the product manual for correct tag encoding.
member.param: The tag string
The tag protocol
Lock the tag so it can't be re-written

member.name: P:Phidgets.RFID.TagPresent
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not a tag is on the reader.
member.remarks: If there is a tag currently being read by the reader, this will return true. Otherwise it returns false.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.RFID.LastTagProtocol
member.summary: Gets the protocol of the last tag read by the reader - this tag may or may not still be on the reader - use TagPresent to find out.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.RFID.LastTag
member.summary: Gets the last tag read by the reader - this tag may or may not still be on the reader - use TagPresent to find out.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.RFID.Antenna
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of the antenna.
member.remarks: True turns the antenna on, False turns it off. The antenna if by default turned off, and needs to be explicitely activated before tags can be read. Control over the antenna allows multiple readers to be used in close proximity, as multiple readers will interfere with each other if their antenna's are activated simultaneously.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: P:Phidgets.RFID.LED
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of the onboard LED.
member.remarks: True turns the LED on, False turns it off. The LED is by default turned off.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached.

member.name: E:Phidgets.RFID.Tag
member.summary: Tag gained event

remarks.para: The tag handler is called when a new tag is seen by the reader. The event is only fired one time for a new tag, so the tag has to be removed and then replaced before another tag gained event will fire.

member.name: E:Phidgets.RFID.TagLost
member.summary: Tag lost event.

remarks.para: The tag lost handler is called when a tag is removed from the reader.

member.name: E:Phidgets.RFID.OutputChange
member.summary: Digital output change event.

remarks.para: The output change handler is called when an output has changed.

member.name: T:Phidgets.RFID.RFIDTagProtocol
member.summary: RFID Tag Protocol

member.remarks: This class was added to support encoders with enable/index.

member.name: P:Phidgets.EncoderEncoderWithEnable.Position
member.summary: Gets / sets the position of an encoder

member.name: P:Phidgets.EncoderEncoderWithEnable.IndexPosition
member.summary: Gets the index position for an encoder that supports index.
member.remarks: This is referenced to the Position.

member.name: P:Phidgets.EncoderEncoderWithEnable.Enabled
member.summary: Gets / sets the enabled state of an encoder.
member.remarks: This controls the power to the encoder.

member.name: T:Phidgets.EncoderEncoderWithEnableCollection
member.summary: This class represents a collection of encoders.

member.name: P:Phidgets.EncoderEncoderWithEnableCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an encoder at an index.
member.param: The index of the encoder to get.

member.name: T:Phidgets.EncoderEncoderCollection
member.summary: This class represents a collection of Encoders.
member.remarks: This class contains the count of the available encoders and the encoder indexer to access the encoders. This returns only the position of each encoder. To access enable/index on the newer encoder board, use the EncoderEncoderWithEnableCollection.

member.name: P:Phidgets.EncoderEncoderCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: The encoder indexer list. This gets or sets the encoder position according to the provided index.

remarks.para: Sets the position of a specific encoder. This resets the internal position count for an encoder. This call in no way actually sends information to the device, as an absolute position is maintained only in the library.
After this call, position changes from the encoder will use the new value to calculate absolute position by using the return from the get property.
Returns the position of an encoder through the get property. This is an absolute position as calcutated since the encoder was plugged in.

member.param: The encoder index.
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the index is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.EncoderEncoderCollection.Count
member.summary: The number of available encoders.
member.remarks: The count property gets the total number of available encoders.

member.name: T:Phidgets.EncoderDigitalInputCollection
member.summary: This class represents a collection of Digital Inputs. All the methods and properties used to access the available digital inputs are implemented in this class.
member.remarks: This class contains the count of the available digital inputs and the digital input indexer to access the digital inputs.

member.name: P:Phidgets.EncoderDigitalInputCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: The digital input indexer list. This gets the state of a digital input at the supplied index in the list.
member.remarks: On the mechanical encoder this refers to the pushbutton. The high speed encoder does not have any digital inputs. A value of true means that the input is active(the button is pushed).
member.param: index of the input
member.exception: If this Phidget is not opened and attached, or if the index is out of range.

member.name: P:Phidgets.EncoderDigitalInputCollection.Count
member.summary: Returns number of digital inputs.
member.remarks: On the mechanical encoder this refers to the pushbutton. The high speed encoder does not have any digital inputs.
